Module App_utils
Package App_utils.printer

Class Menu

java.lang.Object
App_utils.printer.Menu
public class Menu extends Object
Representation of a Menu on terminal, this class can help to build console menus en getting the user input from them

  • Method Details

    • isValidIndex

      private boolean isValidIndex(int selectedIndex)
      Check if the index selected by user does really exist, or if it is available.
      Parameters:
      selectedIndex - Index selected by the user.
      Returns:
      True if is valid, false if not.

    • printMenu

      private void printMenu()
      Print the given data on nice formatted menu form.

    • printEntry

      private void printEntry(int entryIndex, MenuEntry entry)
      Print an entry with a given index.
      Parameters:
      entryIndex - MenuEntry's index.
      entry - MenuEntry object to print.

    • show

      public Menu show()
      Prints the menu with the given data, and receives the user input.

    • getEntryValue

      public <T> T getEntryValue()
      Returns the object corresponding the entry selected by the user. Refers to the initial objects given when adding the entries with data() methods.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Object's type.
      Returns:
      The Object contained in that menuEntry.

    • getSelectedIndex

      public int getSelectedIndex()
      Returns the index given by the user, the last time this object was call.
      Returns:
      Index selected by the user.

    • data

      public <G> Menu data(List<G> entries, Function<G,String> prompter)
      Sets the Menu's entries, and sets a custom Function to print the objects given on the entries.
      Type Parameters:
      G - Type of the object entries.
      Parameters:
      entries - List of MenuEntries.
      prompter - Custom function to print the objects.
      Returns:
      this.

    • data

      public <G> Menu data(List<G> entries, Function<G,String> prompter, Predicate<G> canShowFunction)
      Sets the Menu's entries, and sets a custom Function to print the objects given on the entries.
      Type Parameters:
      G - Type of the object entries.
      Parameters:
      entries - List of MenuEntries.
      prompter - Custom function to print the objects.
      canShowFunction - Custom predicate to check if an Entry can be shown or not. It must receive and object and return a boolean.
      Returns:
      this.

    • indexColors

      public Menu indexColors(AnsiColors color1, AnsiColors color2)
      Sets the colors for printing the index. Play with both colors to set the text foreground and background.
      Parameters:
      color1 -
      color2 -
      Returns:
      this.

      Returns:
